definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin

sentences.english: Finally, again Happy New Year tvxq.
sentences.chinese: 最後，希望你們新年快樂。

sentences.english: Wrm greetings nd biggest wishes for the New Yer!
sentences.chinese: 致以猛烈的祝賀和良好的祝福，新年快樂。

sentences.english: When the party came to the end, we said "Happy New Year" to each other.
sentences.chinese: 當晚會即將結束時，我們互祝“新年快樂”。

sentences.english: They wished me a Happy New Year, every one of those.
sentences.chinese: 他們祝賀我新年快樂，還給我發了中國傳統的紅包。

sentences.english: Let's reach for the sky together. Happy New Year!
sentences.chinese: 讓我們比翼雙飛到天際。新年快樂!

sentences.english: In the season of joy I present my sincere wishes and kind thoughts. May this New Year outshine all the rest.
sentences.chinese: 以我所有的愛心與真誠祝你及全家新年快樂。

sentences.english: Wish you a joyous Chines new year with happiness and good future.
sentences.chinese: 祝新年快樂，幸福吉祥，前程似錦。

sentences.english: Here is a postcard for you . It says:Happy New Year to you .
sentences.chinese: “這裏有張明信片，面着”祝新年快樂。

sentences.english: Wishes for a very happy and prosperous New Year.
sentences.chinese: 謹祝新年快樂幸福，大吉大利。

sentences.english: Thank you, and the same to you.
Dear Liusihong, here I come to visit u, happy new year.
sentences.chinese: 劉思宏同學，我來看你了，新年快樂哦。

sentences.english: We all had a good time. When the party came to the end, we said "Happy New Year" to each other.
sentences.chinese: 當晚會即將結束時，我們互祝“新年快樂”。

sentences.english: On behalf of the Government of Canada and my wife Laureen, I wish you a very Happy New Year.
sentences.chinese: 我代表加拿大政府和我的妻子祝福華人新年快樂。

sentences.english: Go for it! And happy new year.
sentences.chinese: 這是屬於企業家的一年，加油，新年快樂。

sentences.english: Wishing you and your family a very happy new year.
sentences.chinese: 祝願您及全家新年快樂。

definition: to give one's respects/to send a greeting/(fig.) (coll.) to make offensive reference to (somebody dear to the person to whom one is speaking)
May you have a prosperous New Year! (New Year's greeting)
to make a wish/to make a vow/to promise a reward
to have all one's wishes (idiom)/best wishes/all the best/may all your hopes be fulfilled
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
to thank/to apologize/to wither (of flowers, leaves etc)/to decline
to do sth more quickly/Hurry up!/Get a move on!
to celebrate a festival/after the celebrations (i.e. once the festival is over)
